original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽22.36. Sanidassanattika, Saraṇaduka🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nasaraṇaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anidassanaappaṭigho saraṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ naaraṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho araṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta.🔽Naanidassanasappaṭighaṁ naaraṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho araṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sani dassana ttika sa raṇa duka  na sanidassana sappaṭigham na saraṇam dhammam paccayā anidassana appaṭighaḥ saraṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na araṇam dhammam paṭicca sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ araṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā satta  na anidassana sappaṭigham na araṇam dhammam paṭicca sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ araṇaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā satta
translated: The Reversal of the Law🔽The Triad-Couplet Conditional Relations

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ naaraṇañca naanidassanasappaṭighaṁ naaraṇañca dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho araṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sanidassana sappaṭigham na araṇam ca na anidassana sappaṭigham na araṇam ca dhammam paṭicca sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ araṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā satta

original: Hetuyā ekavīsa, adhipatiyā ekavīsa …pe… avigate ekavīsa.
analyzed: hetuyā ekavīsa adhipatiyā ekavīsa pe avigate ekavīsa
translated: As condition being a condition by way of root condition: twenty-one. As condition being a condition by way of predominance condition: twenty-one. As condition being a condition by way of non-hindrance condition: twenty-one.

analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi paṭiccavāra sadisam  hetu ārammaṇa ādi
translated: (The section on the origination of the associated should be expanded as in the Dependent Origination.)🔽… As root-cause condition, etc.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭigho naaraṇo dhammo sanidassanasappaṭighassa araṇassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … satta.🔽Naanidassanasappaṭigho naaraṇo dhammo sanidassanasappaṭighassa araṇassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … satta.
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ na araṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighassa araṇassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ satta  na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ na araṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa nidassana sappaṭighassa araṇassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ satta
translated: A phenomenon that is not-visible and has resistance is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a phenomenon that is visible and has resistance … seven.🔽A phenomenon that is not-visible and has no resistance is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a phenomenon that is visible and has resistance … seven.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭigho naaraṇo ca naanidassanasappaṭigho naaraṇo ca dhammā sanidassanasappaṭighassa araṇassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … satta.🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭigho naaraṇo dhammo anidassanaappaṭighassa araṇassa dhammassa
analyzed: na sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ na araṇaḥ ca na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ na araṇaḥ ca dhammā sa nidassana sappaṭighassa araṇassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ satta  na sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ na araṇaḥ dhammaḥ a nidassana appaṭighassa araṇassa dhammassa
translated: A phenomenon that is not-visible and has resistance and a phenomenon that is not-visible and has no resistance are a condition, as root-cause condition, for a phenomenon that is visible and has resistance … seven.🔽A phenomenon that is not-visible and has resistance is a condition, as object condition, for a phenomenon that is not-visible and has no resistance …

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Naanidassanasappaṭigho naaraṇo dhammo anidassanaappaṭighassa
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ na araṇaḥ dhammaḥ anidassana appaṭighassa
translated: A phenomenon that is not-visible and has no resistance is a condition, as object condition, for a phenomenon that is not-visible and has no resistance …

original: araṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Nasanidassanasappaṭigho naaraṇo ca
analyzed: araṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ na sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ na araṇo ca
translated: A non-conflict object is related to a non-conflict object as object condition.

original: naanidassanasappaṭigho naaraṇo ca dhammā anidassanaappaṭighassa araṇassa dhammassa
analyzed: na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ na araṇaḥ ca dhammā anidassana appaṭighassa araṇassa dhammassa
translated: A non-conflict object that is not visible and has impingement is related to a non-conflict object that is not visible and has no impingement as object condition.

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā ekavīsa, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā ekavīsa, anantare tīṇi …pe… sahajāte nissaye🔽ekavīsa, upanissaye tīṇi, pacchājāte kamme āhāre indriye jhāne magge vippayutte ekavīsa🔽…pe… avigate ekavīsa.
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo saṅkhitta  hetuyā ekavīsa ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā ekavīsa anantare tīṇi pe sahajāte nissaye  ekavīsa upanissaye tīṇi pacchājāte kamme āhāre indriye jhāne magge vippayutte ekavīsa  pe avigate ekavīsa

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvārassa anulomampi paccanīyampi anulomapaccanīyampi paccanīyānulomampi gaṇitaṁ, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike pañhāvārassa anulomam pi paccanīyam pi anuloma paccanīyam pi paccanīya anulomam pi gaṇitaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: In the case of cause, there are twenty-one; in the case of object, there are three; in the case of predominance, there are twenty-one; in the case of proximity, there are three; in the case of contiguity, there are three; in the case of immediacy, there are three; in the case of repetition, there are three; in the case of kamma, there are three; in the case of nutriment, there are three; in the case of faculty, there are three; in the case of jhana, there are three; in the case of path, there are three; in the case of association, there are three; in the case of dissociation, there are three; in the case of presence, there are three; in the case of absence, there are three; in the case of disappearance, there are three; in the case of non-disappearance, there are three; in the case of arising, there are three; in the case of presence and absence, there are three; in the case of non-disappearance and arising, there are three; in the case of non-disappearance and presence and absence, there are three; in the case of the past, there are three; in the case of the future, there are three; in the case of the present, there are three; in the case of the past and future, there are three; in the case of the past and present, there are three; in the case of the future and present, there are three; in the case of the past, future, and present, there are three; in the case of the internal, there are three; in the case of the external, there are three; in the case of the internal and external, there are three; in the case of the gross, there are three; in the case of the subtle, there are three; in the case of the gross and subtle, there are three; in the case of the distant, there are three; in the case of the near, there are three; in the case of the distant and near, there are three; in the case of the wholesome, there are three; in
